messages.title: Learning the harsh lessons from austerity in education
messages.content: Labour is committed to fixing the £8.55m cuts to our schools by: Giving every primary pupil a record funding increase, making our schools fit for the future, and investing in our children.

messages.title: Our NHS should never be for sale
messages.content: Under the Tories, the NHS is in crisis. Labour is committed to: Give the NHS the funding it needs, make prescriptions free, restore the nursing bursary and train more nurses, end hospital car parking charges.

community.content: “I’m happy to support Vernon, someone who has worked hard over many years for the local community. In particular I knew him when he was head of sixth form at Carlton le Willows where he often stopped to speak with students. I know this is something he continues to do as our local MP. His strong commitment to fight against cuts to schools and for the investment in our children’s needs; school places, improvements to buildings and all of our teaching and school staff.” – Neil Kendrick, Former Head of Sixth Form, Carlton le Willows
